_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been prepared to meet the requirements of the Risk Management Program Rule.  As part of complying with the Risk Management Program Rule, NorthStar Chemicals (NorthStar) is continually renewing and enhancing accidental release procedures and emergency response policies. These policies have been incorporated into the facility's Consolidated Emergency Response Plan.  Chemical safety is a core company value with plant management committed to safety and the implementation of safe operating procedures. 



NorthStar manufactures adhesive products.  Operations include mixing, packaging, and storage of primarily solvent-based adhesives.  There are four flammable substances at the NorthStar facility that are regulated by the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions defined at 40 CFR 68. The four chemicals are considered a flammable mixture covered under Process 1.  The maximum amount of flammable mixture stored onsite is approximately 129,000 pounds.  Specific information for each chemical in the flammable mixture is as follows:



- Methyl ether: A propellant added during packaging operations in the adhesive preparation process. The maximum amount of stored onsite is approximately 67,000 pounds. 



- Isobutane: A propellant added during packaging operations in the adhesive preparation process. The maximum amount of stored onsite is approximately 17,000 pounds. 



- Propane: A propellant added during packaging operations in the adhesive preparation process. The maximum amount of stored onsite is approximately 19,000 pounds. 



- Pentane: A solvent used in the adhesive preparation process. The maximum amount of stored onsite is approximately 26,000 pounds. 



There are no toxic substances present at the facility in amounts greater than the threshold quantities per 40 CFR 68.



To address potential accidental releases, an accidental release prevention program along with chemical-specific prevention steps has been developed.  Controls and

mitigation systems include the following:



- Relief and check valves

- Manual and automatic shutoffs

- Interlocks

- Alarms and procedures

- Emergency power

- Grounding equipment

- Excess flow devices

- Sprinkler system and fire wall

- Process area detectors



Also included in the prevention program for the substances listed above are the following programs, practices and procedures:



- Emergency Response

- Emergency Action

- Hazard Communication

- Safe Work Practices

- Operator Training

- Operating procedures



NorthStar has coordinated emergency response activities with the Bartow County Fire Department and the Bartow County Emergency Management Agency. As part of the community involvement efforts, the following activities may be coordinated with the agencies listed above:



- Pre-emergency tours

- Emergency action drills

- Hands-on fire extinguisher training

- Safety data sheets

- Responsibility roles in evacuation procedures

- Plant-wide emergency notification system



As part of preparing the RMP, the facility's five year accident history was reviewed.  During the past five years, there have been no RMP reportable accidental releases.



Through our ongoing implementation of the PSM/RMP program, NorthStar looks continuously for possible changes to improve flammable chemical handling safety in our facility.
